Race.SummaryText:
Fifth Ward Proposition
 (Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 Year, 1 mill property tax renewal for maintaining public cemeteries in the ward.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana, levy a one (1) mill tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $15,077) on all the property subject to taxation within the Fifth Ward of Evangeline Parish, Louisiana (the "Ward") for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of maintaining public cemeteries in the Ward?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Ville Platte -- 30 mills (Property Tax) Mayor & CC - 25 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Ville Platte Proposition 

Summary:  Authority for the City of Ville Platte, Parish of Evangeline (the "City") to levy a 25 year, 30 mills property tax, proceeds of which will be used for the following purposes:  (i) 48% for acquiring, constructing, renovating, improving, extending, maintaining and operating the City's waterworks facilities; and (ii) 52% for the City's general fund to support the acquisition, construction, improvement, maintenance and operation of a new fire station, law enforcement facilities and other public facilities and improvements.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Ville Platte, Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana (the "City"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of 30 mills (the "Tax") on all property subject to taxation in the City for a period of twenty-five (25) years beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2032, the proceeds of which will be dedicated and used for the following purposes: (i) forty-eight percent (48%) for acquiring, constructing, renovating, improving, extending, maintaining and operating the City's waterworks facilities; and (ii) fifty-two percent (52%) for the City's General Fund to support the acquisition, construction, improvement, maintenance and operation of a new fire station, law enforcement facilities and other public facilities and improvements, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana, including Part VI-B, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, and other authority, the title to all facilities which shall be held in the public? (Estimated annual revenues: $1,128,868.00).
